issue.title: atlas motion under bdi control does not perform the same under different real time factor
atlas motion under bdi control does not perform the same under different real time factor

content.raw:
Given all physics parameters are the same (i.e. friction, etc.), simulation should not differ at different update rates.  To rule out other factors, can you try setting up an experiment with different physics `update_rate`s for the same world to see if there's a difference between runs?  Make sure that you are starting each phase of the BDI controller up to walk command at the exact same times in simulation between runs to rule out other factors (note if you are sending the walk command over ros topic, it might not be received by AtlasPlugin at the same simulation time step).

One possibility is that the start time of each phase leading up to walk are not identical between runs, and internal state of the BDI controller are still in some transient state.  For example, if you set the robot to "Stand", and start "Walk" after different pause times between "Stand" and "Walk", the walk behavior will respond differently because the BDI internal states have not converged to the same states.
content.html:
Given all physics parameters are the same (i.e. friction, etc.), simulation should not differ at different update rates. To rule out other factors, can you try setting up an experiment with different physics update_rates for the same world to see if there's a difference between runs? Make sure that you are starting each phase of the BDI controller up to walk command at the exact same times in simulation between runs to rule out other factors (note if you are sending the walk command over ros topic, it might not be received by AtlasPlugin at the same simulation time step).

One possibility is that the start time of each phase leading up to walk are not identical between runs, and internal state of the BDI controller are still in some transient state. For example, if you set the robot to "Stand", and start "Walk" after different pause times between "Stand" and "Walk", the walk behavior will respond differently because the BDI internal states have not converged to the same states.

issue.title: atlas motion under bdi control does not perform the same under different real time factor

content.raw:
I ran the update rate test on the Atlas world to bring the real time factor down to the same rate as in Qual_Test_1, and the problem did not repeat.  I checked further into the models, and discovered that the "stub" hands in Atlas have an inertial_mass of 2.263 verse 4.63 for the Sandia hands in Qual_test_1.  I now think this was the cause.

This case can be closed.
content.html:
I ran the update rate test on the Atlas world to bring the real time factor down to the same rate as in Qual_Test_1, and the problem did not repeat. I checked further into the models, and discovered that the "stub" hands in Atlas have an inertial_mass of 2.263 verse 4.63 for the Sandia hands in Qual_test_1. I now think this was the cause.

This case can be closed.
